sentence: Cows like to eat grass. Munch, munch.
Birds like to eat seeds. Crunch, Crunch.
Pandas like to eat leaves. Munch, munch.
Frogs like to eat bugs. Zap, zap.
Monkeys like to eat fruit. Slurp, slurp.
Allie and Ollie are dogs.
Allie and Ollie are sisters.
Allie and Ollie think they are people.
Allie and Ollie sit like people.
Allie and Ollie eat like people.
Allie and Ollie run like people.
Allie and Ollie sleep like people.
But Allie and Ollie chase cats just like dogs!
Peppa and George are at playgroup. “Good morning, children,” says Madame Gazelle. “Today is a lucky day.”  “Is it my irthday?” asks Danny Dog. “No,” giggles Madame Gazelle. “It’s Chinese New Year!”

Miss Rabbit brings in lots of paper lanterns. She is going to be a helper today. “Chinese New Year is about family and good fortune,” says Madame Gazelle. “Let’s celebrate together!” Everybody cheers. “Hooray!”

The children make Chinese New Year cards. “Why are all the cards red?” wonders Peppa. “In China, red is a very lucky colour,” replies Madame Gazelle. “My dress is red,” squeals Peppa. “I must be extra lucky!”

“Is anyone feeling hungry?” asks Miss Rabbit, bringing out a tray of food. “We are!” shout all the children. There are sweeties, tangerines and little biscuits called fortune cookies. “I like Chinese New Year,” decides Danny, picking up two sweets.

In the afternoon, Madame Gazelle helps everyone get dressed in smart clothes. Madame Gazelle shows them pictures of China. “This house is called a pagoda,” she says. “Repeat after me!” “Pah-go-da!” giggles George.", Peppa's Chinese New Year
Madame Gazelle claps her hands. “Now...” she smiles
book: “it is time for the Chinese New Year parade!” “Wahhhhh!” cries George. George points out of the window. There is a scary dragon in the playground!""

sentence:
“Don’t worry, George,” says Peppa. “It is only a pretend dragon.” “Look underneath,” whispers Madame Gazelle. Miss Rabbit peeps her head out. “Hello, George!” she says.", Peppa's Chinese New Year
The mummies and daddies arrive. The sky lights up with fireworks. Pop! Pop! Pop! “We got here just in time
It is Christmas Eve. Peppa, George and their friends are posting letters to Santa. "I can't wait to see what Santa brings us all," cries Peppa. Everyone is very excited.
That afternoon, Daddy Pig buys the biggest Christmas tree he can find. "Daddy, it won't fit in the car!" Peppa giggles. "I'll just have to carry it home,"grunts Daddy.
Daddy Pig carries the Christmas tree uphill and downhill, all the way home. The tree is heavy and it takes him a long time. Poor Daddy Pig. He is worn out!
Daddy Pig finally makes it home. "Let's decorate the tree," says Mummy Pig. Daddy Pig puts a shiny star at the very top. "Ohhh!" Everyone gasps. The tree looks beautiful.
Peppa and George leave a snack by the fireplace for Santa. "Time for bed now," says Daddy Pig. "Santa won't come unless you're asleep."
Peppa and George are tucked up in bed when they hear a loud THUMP! It's Santa! He can't get down the chimney...so he goes to the front door.
Peppa and George race down the stairs, giggling. "Hello, Peppa and George," cries Santa."Merry Christmas! Now off to bed so I can deliver your presents." Peppa and George go back upstairs to bed.

Hooray! It's Christmas morning. Snort! George gets a toy train, and Peppa gets a yo-yo. But Peppa and George's favourite present was definitely meeting Santa! "This is the best Christmas ever!"cheers Peppa.
It is a lovely autumn day, and Peppa and George are getting ready for their Halloween party.
First, they scoop out a pumpkin to make a lantern. Then Mummy Pig fixes a candle inside and lights it. "Ooh, lovely!" sighs Peppa.
Mummy and Daddy Pig help Peppa and George put on their costumes. Peppa is a witch and George is a dinosaur.
"Heh-heh-heeh!"Peppa cackles."Very witchy!"says Mummy Pig."Dine-saw! Grrrrrr!" growls George.
Peppa and George's friends have arrived. Everyone is wearing a spooky Halloween costume.
Suddenly they hear a howl. "What was that?" asks Peppa. "Only me," says Danny Dog. "I'm a werewolf!"
Peppa notices that Emily Elephant has a green face. "What are you, Emily?" she asks.
"I'm an alien! Bloob! Bloob! Bloob!" she replies, laughing. "And Edmond is a ghost.""Actually, I'm a paranormal apparition," corrects Edmond. "That's a clever-clogs ghost."
Daddy Pig appears at the door."Welcome to the party, everyone!"he booms."Come and have some pumpkin pie!"
Inside,the house is decorated with balloons,cobwebs and hanging toy bats.
Even Madame Gazelle has come to the Halloween party."Hello!"says Suzy Sheep."I've come as a vampire!"
"Ah, a vampire,"sighs Madame Gazelle. "That reminds me of home!"
How strange, Madame Gazelle doesn't seem to have a reflection in the mirror...
Daddy Pig puts on some music for everyone to dance to.
"I love pumpkin parties!"Peppa shouts."I love dressing up!"says Suzy Sheep."And everyone loves pumpkin pie!"says Daddy Pig."Snort!"
What do moms do? Moms do so much!
This mom is feeding her baby.
This mom is washing her baby.
This mom is teaching her baby.
This mom is singing to her baby.
This mom is cuddling her baby.
This mom is protecting her baby.
Moms do so much! What does your mom do?
A frog lays eggs in water.
Tadpoles come out of the eggs.
The tadpoles have long tails.
The tadpoles grow back legs.
The tadpoles grow front legs.
The tadpoles are now froglets.
The froglets grow and grow. The tails grow smaller and smaller.
The froglets are now frogs.
An apple grows in a cycle. How does the cycle go?
First comes the seed.
Then comes the sprout.
Next come the years.
Then comes the tree.
Next come the blooms.
Then come the apples.
Seeds wait inside each apple. The cycle begins again
All ladybugs are insects.
Some ladybugs are red. Some ladybugs are yellow.
Some ladybugs are orange. Some ladybugs are other colors.
Some ladybugs have spots.
Some ladybugs have stripes.
Some ladybugs have just one color.
Some ladybugs eat other insects. Some ladybugs eat plants.
All ladybugs have wings.
There are many kinds of spiders.
A spider has eight legs. It eats bugs.
A spider has eight legs. It can climb.
A spider has eight legs. It can make silk.
A spider has eight legs. It has many eyes.
A spider has eight legs. It lays eggs.
A spider has eight legs. It can live outside.
It can live inside, too!
Are there bears at the zoo?Yes,there are.
Are there monkeys at the zoo? Yes, there are.
Are there elephants at the zoo? Yes, there are.
Are there giraffes at the zoo? Yes, there are.
Are there lions at the zoo? Yes, there are.
Are there hippos at the zoo? Yes, there are.
Are there sea lions at the zoo? Yes, there are.
Are there dinosaurs at the zoo? No, there are not.
Do you know what baby animals are called?
A baby deer is called a fawn.
A baby donkey is called a foal.
A baby gorilla is called an infant
A baby pig is called a piglet.
A baby koala is called a joey.
A baby owl is called an owlet.
Which other baby animals do you know?
Two socks make one pair of socks.
Two shoes make one pair of shoes.
Two gloves make one pair of gloves.
Two skates make one pair of skates.
Two dice make one pair of dice.
two wings make one pair of wings.
Two eyes make one pair of eyes.
Two twins make one pair of twins.
A foot wears a shoe
A chest wears a shirt.
A waist wears a belt.
A finger wears a ring.
A wrist wears a watch.
a head wears a hat.
A face wears a smile.
A heart wears love!
Did you look for you shoe
I looked everywhere. My shoe is not there.
Did you look under the bed?
Did you look in your toy box?
Did you look in your closet?
Oh, no! I did not look everywhere. I did not look there.
What do you see? I see the sun.
What do you see? I see the moon.
What do you see? I see a star.
I wonder about lots of things. I wonder about animals
I wonder about cats. Cats can purr.
How do cats purr?
I wonder about sheep. Sheep can grow wool.
How do sheep grow wool?
I wonder about fish. Fish can sleep.
How do fish sleep?
I wonder about lots of things. Do they wonder about me
I brush my teeth twice a day.
I brush my teeth with toothpaste.
I brush my teeth for two minutes.
I brush my teech in the front.
I brush my teeth in the back.
I brush my teeth on the top.
I brush my teeth on the bottom.
Brushing teeth is fun.
Once there was a little girl called Sophie, and she was having tea with her mummy in the kitchen.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Suddenly there was a ring at the door.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Sophie’s mummy said, "I wonder who that can be."
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: It can’t be the milkman because he came this morning.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And it can’t be the boy from the grocer because this isn’t the day he comes.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And it can’t be Daddy because he’s got his key.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: We’d better open the door and see.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Sophie opened the door, and there was a big, furry, stripy tiger.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: The tiger said, "Excuse me, but I’m very hungry. Do you think I could have tea with you?"
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Sophie’s mummy said, "Of course, come in."
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: So the tiger came into the kitchen and sat down at the table.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Sophie’s mummy said, "Would you like a sandwich?"
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: But the tiger didn’t just take one sandwich. He took all the sandwiches on the plate and swallowed them in one big mouthful. Owp!
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And he still looked hungry, so Sophie passed him the buns.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: But again the tiger didn’t eat just one bun.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: He ate all the buns on the dish.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And then he ate all the biscuits and all the cake, until there was nothing left to eat on the table.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: So Sophie’s mummy said, "Would you like a drink?"
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And the tiger drank all the milk in the milk jug and all the tea in the teapot.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And then he looked round the kitchen to see what else he could find.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: He ate all the supper that was cooking in the saucepans...
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: …and he drank all the milk

sentence: and (he drank) all the orange juice
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: and (he drank) all Daddy’s beer

sentence: and (he drank) all the water in the tap.

sentence: Then he said, “Thank you for my nice tea. I think I’d better go now.” And he went.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Sophie’s mummy said, "I don’t know what to do. I’ve got nothing for Daddy’s supper, the tiger has eaten it all."
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And Sophie found she couldn’t have her bath because the tiger had drunk all the water in the tap.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: Just then Sophie’s daddy came home.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: So Sophie and her mummy told him what had happened, and how the tiger had eaten all the food and drunk all the drink.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: So Sophie’s daddy said, “I know what we’ll do. I’ve got a very good idea. We’ll put on our coats and go to a cafe.”
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: So they went out in the dark, and all the street lamps were lit, and all the cars had their lights on, and they walked down the road to a cafe.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And they had a lovely supper with sausages and chips and ice cream.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: In the morning Sophie and her mummy went shopping and they bought lots more things to eat.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: And they also bought a very big tin of Tiger Food, in case the tiger should come to tea again.
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea

sentence: But he never did.

sentence: The doorbell rings just as Sophie and her mummy are sitting down to tea. Who could it possibly be? What they certainly don't expect to see at the door is a big furry, stripy tiger!
book: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
